column4: How can I tell exactly what version of ubuntu I'm running? I've got a 64bit AMD cpu but not sure if I'm running 32 or 64bit Ubuntu.
lsb_release -a
you downloaded it, surely you know what architecture your linux is
also uname -a will tell you (i686 = 32bit, X86_64 == 64bit)
- Doesn't say if I'm 32 or 64 bit. I didn't install it which is why I'm trying to find out.
can you paste the output of uname -a here, i'll tell you
uname -a says Linux vai 2.6.24-21-generic #1 SMP Tue Oct 21 23:43:45 UTC 2008 i686 GNU/Linux. Does the i686 mean my CPU or the build's bitwidth?
32bit
if its a desktop pc then 32bit is fine
thanx. that explains why it's only seeing 3GB out of my 6GB RAM.
can I upgrade to 64 bit without rebuilding the whole machine?
you need a whole new setup
as your apps will be 64bit too
for stability id hit a 64bit OS as much as you can
I don't really need 64bit apps, just the kernel to get my RAM right?
you can run 32bit apps on a 64bit kernel
right
if you dont like it you can always change
yeah that's what i figure. the install isn't removing any packages so I presume this will all be selectable via grub.
just follow the guide. ive never done it myself
